title: Ticket #7: Run HDFS services as Condor daemons
description:
From Faisal Khan:

I have a working version of a Condor daemon for "pseudo-daemoncore-ify" the Hadoop storage. The gist of my implementation is to configure Hadoop's storage based on condor_config file and spawn appropriate Hadoop's services as Java processes using methods from Daemon Core library. I tried to provide default values for many of the parameters and there is still possibilities to provide defaults for others as well. The Daemon Core commands for start, stop (graceful/fast) and reconfiguration are handled based on the hadoop's own installation shell scripts. Additionally, the log4j based logger of Hadoop is also configured to write a rolling log file under the CONDOR_LOCAL/log directory.

I have placed my implementation along with other necessary files at /p/condor/workspaces/faisal/condor_hadoop_v2.

Here is a small note on the contents of above mentioned directory:

condor_hadoop: Directory containing code for hadoop daemon (named as HDFS), 'Imakefile' for compilation 'libhdfs' folder for an example of using storage client written in C++ using JNI (Java native interface), provided by Hadoop.

hadoop: Directory containing hadoop binaries from version 0.17.

condor_config: Condor's usual configuration file that contains settings for running HDFS.

2009-Jan-15 11:25:56 by khahn:
I found a couple small things when installing the code on CHTC:

* In what appears to be a functioning data service daemon we receive log output indicating:

1/14 18:13:27 dup2 of m_std[0] failed: Bad file descriptor (9)

* on a node where we are only running the data service we see a file created: stderr_namenode as defined in HADOOP_NAMENODE_STDOUT

*In general, hadoop as applied here is missing any security. We are going to temporarily use some deployed iptables rules to block ports: #50010 - this port is assigned in condor configuration for the data node #50070 - statically assigned in hadoop conf directly - web server with stats #90000 - name node runs on this port (faisal needs to confirm this)

Additionally it would be nice to be able to assign all of those ports in the condor configuration (and dictate who could connect to them.. tcp_wrappers style). (I am also suspicious that other ports are in play..such as 50075. I haven't looked too hard at it yet.. this is what faisal gave me for ports used).
